column4: i installed gtk2-engines-industrial but i don't have the option to use industrial icons or window borders
what other packages do i need to get the full industrial theme?
gnome extra themes
industrial icons aren't included on hoary :)
if you want the install ubuntu-artwork from warty (downgrade)
gnome-themes-extras are already included
if you want them you have to install ubuntu-artwork from warty (downgrade)
ok
why would they get rid of industrial icons? that's the default in debian and i found it quite nice
ubuntu artwork downgrade is fully supported :)
it's an option :)
ok, i'll download warty's ubuntu-artwork
I think it's 0.14 version of that
ok, i replaced ubuntu-artwork with warty's version
well, i installed ubuntu-artwork. it changed my gdm theme and background but i still don't see industrial as a theme
or industrial icons
*installed ubuntu-artwork from warty that is
ii  ubuntu-artwork 0.2.14.2-1     Ubuntu themes and artwork
installing warty's ubuntu-artwork didn't work
i still don't see industrial as a theme choice
